title: Open Beta Client Won't Open.
body: This morning I opened league to find a message saying "try the new open beta!" I clicked on this and waited for my league to patch. After it had finished I clicked play and nothing came up. I ended the task and tried opening it again but nothing comes up. Sometimes a black screen will come up but that's it. Please help!!{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
I am having the same issues.  I get the launcher screen but when I select launch - the client program runs (I can see it in processes) but the client never displays. 

I have tried deleting the "lockfile" as suggested.  I have run a LOL repair.  I have run as Administrator, I have run the hextech repair app.  Nothing seems to be working for me.    Can't even revert to the production client.
Running Win Vista SP2.
Same issue here, same OS.
same OS and same issue for me too
Same here.

Fix - Right click the shortcut icon - Troubleshoot compatibility - Try recommended settings..go from there. Will most likely choose Windows 7. Then relaunch League and hit Play. Should load. Click next and save the settings on the troubleshooting app you had open and you're golden.
Says its incompatible program, used to play lol on my laptop all the time. now I cant.
Thank you. This worked for me
IT WORKED THX SO MUCH GOD BLESS IMA GIFT YOU AND FRIEND YOU:D
wheres the shortcut icon
Thank you!! This worked for me. XOXO
Thank you, this worked for me.

I found a solution for me at least. I went into the files itself and when i tried to open it from there I realised there was a file called "locked file" that would duplicate when i tried to open the league client. (Also with a message saying that there is more than one instance of my client being closed and i need to close it to reopen it) After deleting the lock file I was able to open up the launcher and everything was fine.
This worked for me as well....
I tried this and I can open the launcher fine, but when I click "launch" nothing comes up and the 'lockfile' is put into the folder again.
This did not work for me.
This worked for me, I went into my league folder and deleted "lockfile" and then my client ran as normal
I LOVE YOU IT WORKED :D

I'm not exactly sure what's going on, but I have some ideas we can try to rule out possibilities.  As a first step, what happens if you launch the client directly from your Riot Games folder on your PC (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends), instead of an icon on your desktop or taskbar?  Let me know if that helps!

It appears to do the same thing as clicking "play" does. The client appears to be running, according to the task manager, but there is no window. If I then start the .exe file again without terminating the existing instance, the window appears but is blank and cannot be closed.

I'd like to point out that this also apparently makes it impossible to revert to the old client since the option to do so is offered only after clicking the "play" button.

Running on Vista SP2.

You might have some security settings that preventing the game from actually launching.  Go over the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to restore access, which should allow the client to appear.  Let me know if the issue persists.
After going thru 2 diff threads on this i finally got mine to launch by combining two different suggestions, run leagueclient from riot folder AFTER deleting lockfile just below it
OMG THANK YOU SO MUCH IT WORKS <3 {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Thanks !    {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Thank you so much! This fix worked for me.
Thx dude! worked for me too!

Giving administrator access to all related executables I could find didn't help, neither did the other suggestions from the guide.

May it be related to non-default installation directory? I'm running the game from a secondary logical disk.
Same problems for me but nothing seems to work i tried eerything on this site tho :(

i open lol  and suddenly a lockfile apears in the riot file...i tried deleting it and starting over but it apears again.
It has been happening for a week now almost.
i tried both ways ...directly from the folder tried...and even before the client my LoL was already runnin as an admin..and it doesnt work :(

And I already tried restarting as well as launching the client directly from my Riot Games folder (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends), neither solution worked....
I am also experiencing the same issue.
same thing is happening to me..

When i download the new beta client right after the download was done and i clicked launch nothing opens to i click the icon again it said i already have a client open and im not sure what to do except just close it out and im running on a windows vista but before the beta it was working perfectly I really need help and i tried to delete the lock file and still didnt help
I have just restarted my computer and now everything is working fine.
DELETE LOCKFILE WORKED FOR ME

My problem was easy to solve, but really time consuming: go to file and delete the league client. When you open up your launcher, it will update to the league client you were using( beta will update to beta and normal to normal).

Solution in OP if you get a message saying your alpha is corrupt is here:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/FghZcwFX

when i click launch a pop-up appears saying that "League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install alpha client to try again." and I've tried everything people have suggested and nothing works.
wheres the shortcut icon

For all mac users: go to your application folder and find the LoL client. Right click and click "Show Package Contents", click the "Contents" folder then the "LoL" folder. Delete the "lockfile" then rerun the game.

FIX: For those of you still having issues after attempting to run recommended settings through troubleshooting and deleting the lock file. I have fixed mine by straight up deleting the new Beta application from your League of Legends folder. It should have the new icon next to it and be called something like LeagueClient.exe. Delete it and everything should be good to go from relaunch.

I was able to revert back to the old client after having this problem. Go to the League of Legends folder via file explorer (C:/Riot Games/League of Legends). In this folder, you'll notice there are two separate .exe files: "LeagueClient", which has the new LoL icon, and "lol.launcher", which has the old. 

Open the "LeagueClient.exe" from this folder, and you should be able to use the "revert" option in the bottom right of the client that pops up. Everything worked as normal from there.
What i noticed is every time i try to open the "LeagueClient" the "lockfile" open up and when i try to delete it it leave but when i open the "LeagueClient" the lockfile open up again.??
THANK YOU

Has anyone found an actual fix to this because the new client wont even launch far enough for me to revert. I try to open a new process and it gives me a black window that i can't close. I deleted the lock file until i had 28 separate client processes open and ive tried every fix listed to no avail. Pretty irritated at this point that it first of all took all night for a client to install that i now can't even use and reinstalling league of legends would take around 2 days so that's out the window as well. Any ideas?
